data.title: decent food at an easy price
data.text: I have lived here along time and heard many brag about the food. The place is like a local bar anywhere,USA  with a small restaurant attached and gambling machines. I feel comfortable in such places. The food was pretty good. The sandwich was more generous than most. The price was very easy to handle.

data.title: Nice bar, good food, quick service
data.text:
I used to go to the Track Shack a *lot* but haven't been in a while.  I stopped in for lunch and a drink.  They were not busy, which surprised me.  Time was, the place would have been packed on Friday lunch.
   My sandwich was very tasty with a small serving of fries.  Quite appropriate for lunch.  

I will be going back.

data.title: A throwback neighborhood bar and restaurant
data.text: This bar and restaurant, located alongside the Amtrak tracks, has been there since I was a kid. My grade school is on the next block, but I did not drink much in grade school. But my teachers probably did. Very much a local color, neighborhood bar with no frills. A cheap place for a few beers and hanging out. A beautiful antique back bar is almost worth a visit all by itself. The food is variable, depending on your tastes, but worth the price.

data.title: great neighborhood bar
data.text: This is a good neighborhood bar.  Friendly staff and decent food in the restaurant.  Good prices too. Friendly environment to sports fans, and the best fans... STL Cardinals and Chicago Bears

data.title: Great chicken dinner
data.text: I almost hate to write this because I don't want to run into a big crowd once more people learn about this place.  Their Thursday night chicken dinner special is wonderful.  Half a chicken, mashed potatoes, green beans and salad for $8.95.  The chicken is delicious.

data.title: Lunch and I
data.text: It is not really noisy when I go for lunch. I can bring my book or tablet and read.  They have free Wi-Fi and good food. Well it is quite until the trains go by blowing the whistles.  But it doesn't last long. I like the shrimp basket. No frills good food.

data.title: Home Cooking at great prices!
data.text: My Grandparents have been regulars at this restaurant for years. The owner and employees always help them get into the restaurant and know their order. I go every time I am in town and it never disappoints.   They offer a Hamburger Horseshoe which I believe is a Springfield original. The Horseshoe includes bread on the bottom  with a burger with fries on top and cheese sauce on top of the fries. It is delicious and I highly recommend trying one while in town. I am not sure of the hours, because we always go at lunch. The lunch specials are a great price $3.99 for a burger.  There is a full bar on the other side of the restaurant and the prices are fair and the drinks were good. The Track Shack sits right next to the train tracks (hence the name) and the kids love to see the trains go by. The staff is friendly and quick about getting your order and refills. Give this one a try it's a small family restaurant with awesome homemade marinara sauce and salad dressing!!! Recommend : Lasagna,  Horseshoe and Sausage!

data.title: Thursday night fried chicken
data.text: Was out with some friends and decided to drop in at the Track Shack.  Ran into some other friends there, server was very accommodating and joined a couple more tables for us.  Fried chicken dinner (1/2 chicken with green beans, potatoes (Italian style is fantastic) and dessert under $15.00.  Restaurant was full but server was on the spot whenever we needed something.

data.title: Thursday Chicken night
data.text: Good value for Fried Chicken.  Has become a tradition for us.  Probably the best fried chicken in town.

data.title: A Dive - But In the Best Sort of Way
data.text: Went here with a friend on her birthday.  The main reason we ate here was so her brother, who works nearby, could join us.  This place is so quirky that it is really charming!  Just a few tables and a bar.  The building must be very old; the bar was hand-carved and beautiful.  Our waitress was super.  The menu was more extensive than I would have imagined, but we just had onion rings and sandwiches.  My Italian Sausage sandwich was very tasty.  I think we may have shaken things up a bit when we ordered wine and a couple of gin-and-tonics, but the drinks were fine.  The wine was from those little 175ml bottles like you get on an airplane.  You have to love it!  I think most of their clientele drink beer.  We all had a great time, and a pretty decent and inexpensive lunch.  Best of all, on the way out we spotted a bank of slot machines by the door, and, since it was my friend's birthday, I put in a twenty and let her play.  She won $61, which was more than lunch for the three of us cost, drinks and all.

data.title: Go for Lunch
data.text: The lunch specials are priced great and the food and atmosphere are great, if you want a sort of Bar/Grill ambiance and decent food then definitely try this out.

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text:
The Track Shack has been hidden away, next to the Amtrak tracks for many years.   It's really a small restaurant that has a bar.  
The dining facility seats about 50 and is separate from the bar.
While the menu is basically Italian, it has a variety of choices.  
On our most recent visit, I had the meatloaf lunch while two of our party had chili.  Food is served in a timely manner and meets every expectation.  Hot and Tasty.
We started with an appetizer, hot roasted ravioli with a delicious red sauce.  No sooner did we finish them than the rest of the food was on the table.  
The service is excellent and the price is right.   
And if you know the owner, he'll sit and visit while you're waiting or after you finish the meal.
You can't beat the friendliness.
